str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Known, an acquaintance. From ginosko; well-known.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
A woman, wife, my lady. Probably from the base of ginomai; a woman; specially, a wife.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: To accompany, follow together with. From sun and akoloutheo; to accompany.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Of Hebrew origin; Galiloea, a region of Palestine.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: A prolonged form of a primary stao stah'-o; to stand, used in various applications.
From a (long) distance, afar. Adverb from makros; from a distance or afar.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Feminine Plural
str2: Properly, to stare at, i.e. to discern clearly; by extension, to attend to; by Hebraism, to experience; passively, to appear.
